caption.p: Colocalization of RS and microfold cells (M cells) on the intestinal epithelium of mice. Fluorescein isothiocyanate (FITC)-labeled RS was orally administered to mice, and samples of the intestinal epithelium were collected 30 min after administration. Histological analysis of intestinal tissues stained by FITC-labeled RS, Rhodamine-labeled Ulex Europaeus Agglutinin I (M cell), and 4’,6-diamidino-2-phenylindole (DAPI) (nuclei) are shown. Bars: 50 μm.
